Time Series Resample Plan Data Preparation

Source: R/diagnostics-tk_time_series_cv_plan.R
tk_time_series_cv_plan.Rd

The tk_time_series_cv_plan() function provides a simple interface to prepare a time series resample specification (rset) of either rolling_origin or time_series_cv class.

tk_time_series_cv_plan(.rset)

Arguments

.rset

A time series resample specification of of either rolling_origin or time_series_cv class.

Details

Resample Set

A resample set is an output of the timetk::time_series_cv() function or the rsample::rolling_origin() function.

See also

  • time_series_cv() and rsample::rolling_origin() - Functions used to create time series resample specfications.

  • plot_time_series_cv_plan() - The plotting function used for visualizing the time series resample plan.

Examples

library(tidyverse)
library(tidyquant)
library(rsample)
library(timetk)

FB_tbl <- FANG %>%
    filter(symbol == "FB") %>%
    select(symbol, date, adjusted)

resample_spec <- time_series_cv(
    FB_tbl,
    initial = 150, assess = 50, skip = 50,
    cumulative = FALSE,
    lag = 30,
    slice_limit = n())

resample_spec %>% tk_time_series_cv_plan()
#> # A tibble: 3,220 x 5
#>    id      key      symbol date       adjusted
#>    <chr>   <fct>    <chr>  <date>        <dbl>
#>  1 Slice01 training FB     2015-10-23     102.
#>  2 Slice01 training FB     2015-10-26     104.
#>  3 Slice01 training FB     2015-10-27     104.
#>  4 Slice01 training FB     2015-10-28     104.
#>  5 Slice01 training FB     2015-10-29     105.
#>  6 Slice01 training FB     2015-10-30     102.
#>  7 Slice01 training FB     2015-11-02     103.
#>  8 Slice01 training FB     2015-11-03     103.
#>  9 Slice01 training FB     2015-11-04     104.
#> 10 Slice01 training FB     2015-11-05     109.
#> # … with 3,210 more rows
